The message carried the subject “Re: Samuel Clites” and set in motion a note indicating that certain items should be removed from the Anthem lien.

Earlier in the day, there was a message from Aaron Whaley dated Wednesday, December 4, 2024 at 1:56 PM, addressed to Aries Penaflor, Justin Chumbley, Jessica Bottorff, and Samuel Clites – Filevine Project Email Address, with the subject “Samuel Clites.” In that note, Aaron wrote: “We need a record and was sent to get this a month ago with no action. No point in negotiating if there is another record and bill.” The message was signed with the typical closing information for Aaron Whaley, Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, 502-583-4022. The file thread and signatures end with the sign-off line: “-- Aaron Whaley Whaley Law Firm 712 Lyndon Ln Louisville, KY 40222 502-583-4022.”

episodes.original_body:
Case: Samuel-Clites-MVA-4-23-2024
Client: Samuel Clites

Mr Clites brought in a bill he rec'd (twice) from Credit Bureau Systems - he is concerned because he does not want that to impact his credit - as he needs a replacement vehicle. Gave the bill to AGW - he needs to know if this is the hospital bill (does not note on collection notice).
I called credit bureau - she confirmed it is on behalf of Baptist Health#cc
episodes.natural_language: Initial client contact on April 23, 2024 with Samuel Clites regarding a billing issue. Mr. Clites brought in a bill he received twice from Credit Bureau Systems and expressed concern that it could impact his credit, as he needs a replacement vehicle. He handed the bill to AGW for review to determine whether it represents a hospital bill, noting that the collection notice did not specify the hospital. I called the credit bureau, and the representative confirmed that the bill is being reported on behalf of Baptist Health, with reference code #cc.
episodes.author: Faye Gaither

episodes.natural_language:
In the Samuel-Clites-MVA-4-23-2024 case for client Samuel Clites, the team was addressing the Baptist Health bill. On December 16, 2024, at 12:10 PM, Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm sent an email to Justin Chumbley and copied Aries Penaflor and Samuel Clites’ Filevine project address. The message requested a log showing payments made so far so the balance could be forwarded to collections.

Earlier that same day, around 12:09 PM, a reply noted that the Baptist Health bill had apparently been previously sent on November 1, 2024. In that thread, Aries Penaflor was instructed to resend the bill and then call PIP to ask what the issue was, if any.

In the body of Aaron Whaley’s December 16 message (sent at 12:07 PM to Aries Penaflor, Justin Chumbley, and the Samuel Clites Filevine address), he referenced the attached Baptist Health bill and stated that health insurance had paid some of it but the remaining balance needed to be paid by PIP. He asked that the bill be forwarded to PIP with a direction of payment. The message included contact details for Aaron Whaley at the Whaley Law Firm, including the firm’s address (712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222) and phone number (502-583-4022).
episodes.author: Aaron Whaley
